description: An autoimmune disease that can affect multiple organs and cause a wide range of symptoms

and neuropsychiatric manifestations such as psychosis.
    }
description: A rare blood disorder characterized by hemolytic anemia
neurological symptoms (including confusion and altered mental status)

and renal dysfunction leading to proteinuria.
    }
description: An autoimmune disorder that can cause thrombocytopenia

and neuropsychiatric symptoms. It is often associated with SLE and can lead to renal involvement and proteinuria.
    }
description: An autoimmune disorder that affects the lungs and kidneys
and glomerulonephritis with proteinuria. In rare cases

it may also cause neurological symptoms.
    }
description: A multisystem granulomatous disorder that can affect various organs

and the central nervous system (potentially leading to psychosis). Hematologic abnormalities like anemia and thrombocytopenia may also occur.
    }

      name: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia (AIHA) with coincidental conditions
description: A primary autoimmune disorder causing hemolytic anemia
which may coexist with other autoimmune or systemic conditions that lead to thrombocytopenia
description: A group of disorders characterized by inflammation of blood vessels

and nervous system. Hematologic abnormalities and neuropsychiatric symptoms may also occur.
    }
description: A group of rare disorders triggered by an abnormal immune response to a neoplasm
which can cause a variety of symptoms affecting different organ systems

{
      name: Thrombotic microangiopathy secondary to malignant hypertension
description: Severe hypertension can cause endothelial damage and lead to a thrombotic microangiopathy
and renal dysfunction with proteinuria. In some cases

it may also cause neurological symptoms.
    }
description: Some rare genetic disorders can cause a combination of hematologic abnormalities

and neurological symptoms due to underlying complement or coagulation system abnormalities.
    }

diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohns disease or ulcerative colitis)
or fungal infections affecting the ears
Allergies - allergic rhinitis or other allergic reactions causing symptoms in multiple body systems
Asthma - chronic respiratory condition that can cause coughing and be exacerbated by allergies or infections
Endometriosis - disorder of the female reproductive system that can cause dysmenorrhea and be associated with immune dysfunction
Anemia - low red blood cell count which can cause fatigue
Anxiety disorders - mental health conditions that can cause physical symptoms like difficulty concentrating
Thyroid disorders - hyperthyroidism or hypothyroidism affecting metabolism and multiple body systems
Chronic fatigue syndrome - condition of severe
ongoing fatigue often following a viral infection
Fibromyalgia - chronic disorder causing widespread pain
cognitive difficulties and other variable symptoms
Multiple sclerosis - autoimmune disease affecting the nervous system which can cause a wide range of neurological symptoms
